business.headline: UK's Guardian in talks to sell Observer newspaper to Tortoise Media: ReportTortoise said negotiations include a commitment from it to invest more than 25 million pounds ($33 million) over the next five years in the editorial and commercial renewal of the title.

Smriti Irani discusses gender parity with World Bank leaders, highlights India's progressDuring her meeting in Washington, Smriti Irani highlighted the need for effective implementation of gender equity policies to ensure that women, especially in developing regions, can contribute to both government and industry while realising their full potential.

Sebi withdraws statement blaming external elements for staff protestsJust under two weeks ago, Sebi had issued a statement suggesting that external forces were behind the unrest among its staff, which was seen as an attempt to discredit the organisation and its leadership.

Check these alternate optionsBajaj Housing Finance bumper listing: By the end of the trading session, the company's stock price stood at Rs 164.99, marking a significant increase over its IPO issue price. Oberoi inheritance war: Siblings clash over late PRS Oberoi's willOn one side are Vikramjit Oberoi, Natasha Oberoi, and Arjun Oberoi. On the other side is Anastasia Oberoi, PRS Oberoi's daughter from his second marriage to Mirjana Jojic Oberoi.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 8 killed, nearly 3,000 injured in Lebanon pager blasts, Hezbollah blames IsraelAccording to Reuters, a Hezbollah official said the detonation of the pagers was the "biggest security breach" the group had been subjected to in nearly a year of war with Israel.

Arvind Kejriwal quits as Chief Minister, Atishi stakes claim to form governmentAtishi's name was proposed by Kejriwal at the meeting of the legislature party, and it was unanimously accepted by the AAP MLAs.

PM in US from September 21-23 for Quad, will address UN General AssemblyAccording to a release by the Ministry of External Affairs, PM Modi will attend the Quad meeting in Wilmington, Delaware, which will be hosted by US President Joe Biden.
Rapper Sean 'Diddy' indicted on sex trafficking and racketeering chargesAmerican rapper Sean 'Diddy' Combs has been charged with sex trafficking. Combs had been arrested late Monday in Manhattan, US.

Moment Hezbollah members' pagers exploded at grocery store in LebanonIn a grocery store in Lebanon, Hezbollah members were injured when the pagers they used to communicate exploded.  Over 1,000 individuals, including Hezbollah fighters and medics, were injured across Lebanon.

India win 5th Asian Champions Trophy hockey title after beating resolute ChinaJugarj Singh's 51st minute goal proved to be the difference as India defeated China 1-0 in the final to win their 5th Asian Champions Trophy on September 17, Tuesday.

Wave of pager detonations in Lebanon lasted an hour: What we know so farThe wave of pager explosions that injured over 2,750 people, including Hezbollah fighters and the group's medical personnel, lasted for about an hour after the initial blasts.

Video: Portion of Delhi-Mumbai Expressway in Rajasthan's Dausa caves inA video recorded by commuters shows a deep crater in the middle of the road on the Delhi-Mumbai Expressway. Another video shows a bulldozer removing the debris.

How Kejriwal is using Atishi to repackage AAP before pollsAAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal stepped down as the chief minister of Delhi and named Atishi as his successor. The move, months ahead of the Assembly polls, is to repackage the AAP by getting a taint-free person as its face even as the hands pulling the strings remain the same.

Government making roadmap for peace in Manipur, border fencing work on: Amit ShahUnion Home Minister Amit Shah said the government was preparing a roadmap for restoring peace in violence-hit Manipur and talking to the Meitei and Kuki communities. He said 30 km of fencing work was completed on the India-Myanmar border.

Heavy rain in Delhi during rush hour, crippling traffic jamsThe India Meteorological Department (IMD) had predicted rainfall on Tuesday and Wednesday in Delhi due to the influence of a depression caused as an aftermath of Cyclone Yagi, which is moving northwestwards from Jharkhand.

Congressman Ro Khanna slams assault on India Today reporter by Rahul Gandhi's teamIndian-American Congressman Ro Khanna has come out in support of journalist Rohit Sharma who was assaulted by Rahul Gandhi's team in Dallas, Texas. Sharma reported being physically assaulted and having his phone seized by Gandhi's team in the run-up to the Congress leader's visit to Dallas.

How Aditi Rao Hydari, Siddharth's wedding photographer clicked their sunrise picAditi Rao Hydari and Siddharth got married in a traditional ceremony and shared pictures from the event on social media. Now, their wedding photographer Joseph Radhik has revealed the tricks he used to capture the stunning moments.

Swati Maliwal attacks Atishi, says her family fought to stop Afzal Guru's hangingRajya Sabha MP Swati Maliwal, who's had a bitter falling out with the Aam Aadmi Party, criticised the decision to appoint Atishi as Delhi's Chief Minister. Maliwal said that her parents had fought to prevent terrorist Afzal Guru's execution.

100 days of Modi 3.0 vs Modi 2.0: Why C is for contrastAs Modi 3.0 marks its first 100 days with a blend of bold moves and strategic retreats, the contrast with the sweeping reforms of Modi 2.0 is clearly visible. Short of a majority, the BJP's shift from big-bang actions to a more cautious approach shows that in the dance of democracy, compromise is as crucial as ambition.

Maharashtra teacher rushes to resolve fight among students only to get a surprise. VideoA teacher got a surprise when she rushed to stop a fight among students in the classroom. A video of the episode went viral on social media.
Supreme Court pauses unauthorised bulldozer action till October 1The court stated that its directives are not applicable to any unauthorised construction on public roads, footpaths, among others.

Florida boy, 11, arrested after mass shooting threat, bragging about 'kill list'An 11-year-old boy from Florida, Carlo 'Kingston' Dorelli, was arrested after making violent threats and showing classmates a video of his weapons collection. The boy faced felony charges for making a written threat of a mass shooting.

Improved Mehidy Hasan ready to take over Shakib's place: HathurusinghaBangladesh head coach Chandika Hathurusingha lauded Medhidy Hasan as the most improved player in the side. The coach said that the spin-bowling all-rounder is ready to take over Shakib Al Hasan's place when the legend retires.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
